member.summary: The maximum number of elements allowed in the collection.

member.summary: The mutual-exclusion lock protecting the collection.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1._notFull
member.summary: A condition variable that is signalled when the collection is not full.

member.name: F:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1._completedOrNotEmpty
member.summary: A condition variable that is signalled when the collection is completed or not empty.

member.summary: A cancellation token source that is canceled when the collection is marked completed for adding.

member.summary: A cached result that is common when calling .

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.#ctor(System.Collections.Concurrent.IProducerConsumerCollection{`0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new async-compatible producer/consumer collection wrapping the specified collection and with a maximum element count.
member.param: The maximum element count. This must be greater than zero.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.TryAddAsync(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken,Nito.AsyncEx.TaskCompletionSource)
member.summary: Attempts to add an item.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the add operation. If is not null, then this token must include signals from the object.
A synchronization object used to cancel related add operations. May be null if this is the only add operation.

member.summary: Attempts to add an item. This method may block the calling thread.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the add operation.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.TryAddAsync(`0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Attempts to add an item to the producer/consumer collection. Returns false if the producer/consumer collection has completed adding or if the item was rejected by the underlying collection.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the add operation.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.OutputAvailableAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits until an item is available to dequeue. Returns false if the producer/consumer collection has completed adding and there are no more items.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the asynchronous wait.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.OutputAvailableAsync
member.summary: Asynchronously waits until an item is available to dequeue. Returns false if the producer/consumer collection has completed adding and there are no more items.

member.summary: Provides a (synchronous) consuming enumerable for items in the producer/consumer collection.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the synchronous enumeration.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.GetConsumingEnumerable
member.summary: Provides a (synchronous) consuming enumerable for items in the producer/consumer queue.

member.summary: Attempts to take an item.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the take operation. If is not null, then this token must include signals from the object.

member.summary: Attempts to take an item from the producer/consumer collection.

member.summary: Attempts to take an item from the producer/consumer collection. This method may block the calling thread.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.TakeAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Takes an item from the producer/consumer collection. Returns the item. Throws if the producer/consumer collection has completed adding and is empty, or if the take from the underlying collection failed.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the take operation.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.Take(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Takes an item from the producer/consumer collection. Returns the item. Throws if the producer/consumer collection has completed adding and is empty, or if the take from the underlying collection failed. This method may block the calling thread.

member.summary: Takes an item from the producer/consumer collection. Returns the item. Throws if the producer/consumer collection has completed adding and is empty, or if the take from the underlying collection failed.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.Take
member.summary: Takes an item from the producer/consumer collection. Returns the item. Throws if the producer/consumer collection has completed adding and is empty, or if the take from the underlying collection failed. This method may block the calling thread.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.TakeResult
member.summary: The result of a TryTake, TakeFromAny, or TryTakeFromAny operation.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.TakeResult.Collection
member.summary: The collection from which the item was taken, or null if the operation failed.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.TakeResult.Success
member.summary: Whether the operation was successful. This is true if and only if is not null.

member.name: P:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection`1.TakeResult.Item
member.summary: The item. This is only valid if is not null.

member.name: T:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollectionExtensions
member.summary: Provides methods for working on multiple instances.

member.name: M:Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollectionExtensions.TryAddToAnyAsync``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Nito.AsyncEx.AsyncCollection{``0}},``0,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Attempts to add an item to any of a number of producer/consumer collections. Returns the producer/consumer collection that received the item. Returns null if all producer/consumer collections have completed adding, or if any add operation on an underlying collection failed.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the add operation.
member.returns: The producer/consumer collection that received the item.

Returns null if all producer/consumer collections have completed adding, or if any add operation on an underlying collection failed. This method may block the calling thread.
member.param: A cancellation token that can be used to abort the add operation.
member.returns: The producer/consumer collection that received the item.
